avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Lo for 20/1. Insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard. See blogs for mountain information

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Some light snow is expected over the highest summits but no significant snow accumulations
Observed Weather Influences: It has been a dry and mainly sunny day with the freezing level around 1000m.
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Very limited snow patches remain, mainly on North through East to South-East aspects above 1000m. These will continue to consolidate and are stable. There is currently insufficient snow to warrant an avalanche forecast and no forecast will be published until conditions change. Further information on mountain conditions can be found on the SAIS Northern Cairngorms blog.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Fresh South-Westerly winds. No precipitation forecast. The freezing level is expected to lower to around summit levels from mid-day onwards.

ObservedSnowStability:

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information on mountain conditions, please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
avalancheActivity.highlights: SC 20.01.25 Insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard. No avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. See SAIS blog

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: No precipitation forecast. Moderate to fresh West-South-Westerly winds. Freezing level lowering to 1250 metres during the afternoon.
Observed Weather Influences: Dry and sunny with fresh South-Westerly winds at summit level. Minus 1 degrees Centigrade at 930 metres at midday in the south of the area. Temperature inversion with some high tops warmer than the glen.
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information on mountain conditions, please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. Information on mountain conditions can be found on the SAIS Creag Meagaidh blog.
avalancheActivity.highlights: CM for 20.1 Currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: It is expected to be a dry day, with the freezing level lowering to around 1100 metres. Winds will be moderate South-South-Westerly.
Observed Weather Influences: It was a dry day, with light to moderate, mainly Southerly winds. After an overnight frost in the glens it was another mild day.
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: After some light overnight rain a dry day is expected. The freezing level will drop to around summit level during the day.
Observed Weather Influences: A dry day with the freezing level just above the highest tops
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Cloudy with the possibility of some light rain or sleet on the tops overnight into Monday morning. Freezing level just above summits throughout the day. Winds will be Fresh, South-South-Westerly.
